page.title: 14E.ALLINGTON DAIRY FARM
page.content: A typical day on a dairy farm begins at 6.30 when the cows come in for milking. While being milked each cow is fed dairy cake according to milk yield. The milk goes into glass jars then through to a stainless steel bulk tank in the dairy. After milking the cows are turned out to grass or back into the silage and cubicle house.All the equipment in the milking parlour is then cleaned and sterilized by automatic circulation of hot water. During milking a watch is kept for any cows needing the vet or A.I man and these are kept apart from the herd. Milking is repeated in the afternoon or early evening. Each cow produces approximately 4500 litres or more during her lactation and her useful milking life is about l0 years. The bulk milk tankers call at each farm daily to take the milk to the factory.
